title: Lotherton Hall Walk Route

images.title: Darren Haddock / Lotherton Hall
images.caption: Lotherton Hall's Edwardian gardens. Lotherton Hall was given to Leeds City Council in 1968 and contains a museum, art gallery, deer park, bird garden and extensive gardens.

images.title: Hall Family / Two Pink Flamingos At Lotherton Hall Bird Garden
images.caption: Two Pink Flamingos At Lotherton Hall Bird Garden

images.title: I Love Colour / The Walled Garden, Lotherton Hall Estate.
images.caption: The Walled Garden, Lotherton Hall Estate.

images.title: Andrew Whale / The Chapel, Lotherton Hall
images.caption: The Chapel. Taken from the courtyard in front of Lotherton Hall, which is to the right. Norman windows remain in the chapel — suggesting a date of 1170-1180.

images.title: Formal garden at Lotherton Hall (2) by Stephen Craven, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Formal garden

images.title: Neil T from Bradford, United Kingdom, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Deer in the deer park

images.title: Andrew Whale / Bluebells, Lotherton Hall
images.caption: Bluebells. On the edge of a wooded area. It looks like there will be lots of daffodils in bloom in a few weeks time. This picture was shown on BBC Look North by Paul the Weatherman, on 26/3/09.

images.title: Café at Lotherton Hall by Ian S, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The cafe

description: Explore the beautiful grounds of this Edwardian house once home to the Gascoigne family. The estate includes a deer park and a bird garden with 200 magnificent species including flamingos and snowy owls. There are also lovely formal gardens with gravel paths and yew hedges, a rock garden and a walled garden. There are several different walks taking you through the grounds, woodland, orchards and deer park. On the way look out for a variety of wildlife and an interesting Norman chapel dating from the 12th century. Facilities include tea rooms and a gift shop. Lotherton Hall is located near Garforth, about 11 miles from the centre of Leeds.
